sections.heading: GST Overview of LUTs (Letters of Undertaking)
content: Eligible exporters can export goods or services without paying IGST by using a Letter of Undertaking (LUT) under GST.
Exporters can avoid blocking working capital and guarantee more seamless international transactions by filing LUT in Form GST RFD-11.

sections.heading: Who May Submit a GST LUT?
content: GST LUT may be submitted by:

points: Suppliers to SEZ developers or units
GST-registered taxpayers who have not been prosecuted for more than ₹2.5 crore in tax evasion
Export without having to pay IGST
IGST refunds do not need to be claimed later.

sections.heading: GST LUT's validity
content: LUT is good for a single fiscal year. Must be renewed annually prior to exporting

sections.heading: How to File a GST LUT

points: Go to Services → User Services → Furnish LUT (RFD-11).
Complete the necessary information and declarations.
Use DSC or EVC to submit
